data.title: Missing a mouse/cursor node
data.body:
I don't now if this was suggested before but I'm missing a mouse/cursor node.

Idea behind:
- camera follow mouse
- change mouse cursor
- mouse can be animated with animationplayer
- hide and show mouse (in game movie)
- catch mouse (tutorial)
  and more

I know you can do this with GDScript but I'm a visually programmer! :-)

data.title: Better hidden folders display preferences for editor file dialogs
data.body:
Small improvements for file dialogs:
- By default FileDialog and EditorFileDialog don't show hidden folders as, by default, is set as false in the editor settings.
  https://github.com/godotengine/godot/blob/master/tools/editor/editor_settings.cpp#L517
- EditorFileDialog hidden folders visibility can be toggled using editor settings "file_dialog/show_hidden_folders" option.

Closes #2041.

data.title: Theora libs VideoPlayer, serious speed issues
data.body:
Theora library for loading ogv and ogm on custom builds with theora activated have freaking serious speed issues, which you can see right here:
https://youtu.be/PFc3J457CjY

VLC isn't really fast on this computer because of SimpleScreenRecorder, but video playing on godot without SimpleScreenRecorder is really odd: at first the video plays fine then begins to have some issues to keep up the rythm at the end, tried out with 2 videos manually converted from wmv to ogv which runs just fine with VLC.

Just thougt it'd be cool to write out at least an issue on it, since video playing is, for in-game cinematics, something you can't, most of the time, avoid, and so a big feature that should come up with Godot 2.0 at release time.

data.title: Properties from scripts do not update in the inspector when they are changed in an external editor
data.body:
If I add/edit a property in a script (ex: add "export var new_property = 1") from an external editor, the change will not be reflected in the inspector unless I restart godot.  Closing and reopening the scene does not help, nor does selecting some other node and re-selecting the node with the changed property (which often works for the internal editor). 

Note: I have the external editor setting enabled.

data.title: Script Editor: maintain cursor column after duplicate a line
ogg not linked properly in libdrivers2 when building with webp=no (due to max_src being too low)
data.body:
When building the current HEAD, I get:

```
g++ -o bin/godot.x11.opt.tools.64 platform/x11/godot_x11.x11.opt.tools.64.o platform/x11/context_gl_x11.x11.opt.tools.64.o platform/x11/os_x11.x11.opt.tools.64.o platform/x11/key_mapping_x11.x11.opt.tools.64.o -L/usr/lib64 main/libmain.x11.opt.tools.64.a modules/libmodules.x11.opt.tools.64.a bin/tests/libtests.x11.opt.tools.64.a drivers/libdrivers.x11.opt.tools.64.a drivers/libdrivers1.x11.opt.tools.64.a drivers/libdrivers2.x11.opt.tools.64.a drivers/libdrivers3.x11.opt.tools.64.a drivers/libdrivers4.x11.opt.tools.64.a tools/libtool.x11.opt.tools.64.a scene/libscene.x11.opt.tools.64.a servers/libservers.x11.opt.tools.64.a core/libcore.x11.opt.tools.64.a -lX11 -lXinerama -lXcursor -lssl -lcrypto -lfreetype -lpulse-simple -lpulse -lGL -lGLU -lpthread -lasound -lz
/usr/bin/ld: drivers/libdrivers2.x11.opt.tools.64.a(opusfile.x11.opt.tools.64.o): undefined reference to symbol 'ogg_sync_pageout'
/lib64/libogg.so.0: error adding symbols: DSO missing from command line
```

Note that I'm building with `webp=no` due to #2995.

Platform: Mageia 5 x86_64, gcc 4.9.2.

data.title: Appease the OCD of all repository watchers eagerly waiting for issue 3000
data.body: Here you are.

data.title: Add constructor for Image built-in type
data.body: Closes #2998.

data.title: Ability to create a new Image from GDScript
data.body:
Usage scenario - I want to create a height map at run time and then set that image as the texture for a sprite (in this case just for debugging purposes so I can see the height map).  The Image built in type does not seem to allow creation from GDScript with control over the format, size, etc.  Creating an empty image and then using resized() on it crashes godot.

There are a couple create methods in image.cpp that look to do what I would like but I don't think they are exposed.

data.title: Image size for texture incorrect on Android
data.body:
Tested under 2.0 20150930 alpha and 1.1 stable.  On windows 7 the attached program shows the texture image size correctly:

```
texture info [ImageTexture:512] [Image] 4
render size 64 64
```

Running under Android on a 2013 Moto-X shows the image as 0x0 in size even though the texture does display correctly.  

```
texture type [ImageTexture:507] [Image] 0
render size 0 0
```

It seems like get_data() on a texture on Android is returning an Image that does not have any actual data in it.  That attached android_image_test.png file is a zip with a project that replicates the problem.

![android_image_test](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/4614207/11610351/6488d754-9b6e-11e5-828b-e19b1175c4ef.png)

data.title: New webp driver does not build on linux with gcc 4.9.2
data.body:
The error is:

```
drivers/webp/enc/webpenc.c: In function 'WebPEncode':
drivers/webp/enc/webpenc.c:324:14: error: 'WebPConfig' has no member named 'exact'
   if (!config->exact) {
              ^
```

Seen on Mageia 5, x86_64.
GCC 4.9.2, glibc 2.20.

data.title: Parent directory "../" in File Chooser should not be shown at the root of "res://"
data.body:
I am running on linux using current git.
Steps to reproduce:
1. Create a Sprite
2. Inspector->Sprite->Texture->Load
3. Try going up the directory tree and nothing happens

Clicking the Up Arrow or the double-dot folder does not work.

If I use the Import feature, the File Chooser works correctly.

data.title: updated the RegEx library nrex to v0.1
data.body:
After implementing unit testing to nrex I caught and fixed some errors so it should behave more like Python's RegEx In addition, I've added version numbering so it should be easier to tell if the library needs updating. Here is a list of changes:
- Fixed zero count quantifiers failing.
- Fixed infinite recursion if quantifying zero length tokens.
- Fixed `$` (as a string pattern on its own) not matching.
- Fixed look behind rewinding beyond the start of the string.
- Added support for alternative back reference format `\g{1}` similar to
  Python. This allows digits to be used immediately after back references.
- Number of capture groups are still limited to 9 by default but can now
  be manually set, with option for no limit at all. (Python has no limit)
- Curly bracket quantifiers `{0}` no longer interpreted as a literal
  string if previous token is not quantifiable. (Python behaviour - Would now result in a compile error)

data.title: collisions does not works afther replacing static2d node

data.title: Set default destination filename of imported font
data.body: to be input font filename if destination filename was ".fnt" (ie. no filename set by user)

data.title: Export named flags property with GDScript
data.body:
The Texture resource has a "Flags" property in which you can select multiple elements in a list. There's no current way to export such a property via GDScript.

![godot-named-flags](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/5599796/11593971/7caad412-9a8e-11e5-895c-2b0a5f52f92a.png)

I suggest to expand in the current flags property format:

``` GDScript
# This is the current format for flags, like the CanvasItem's Light Mask property:
export(int, FLAGS) var current_flags

# Suggested format for named flags:
export(int, FLAGS, "Name 1", "Name 2", "And so on") var named_flags
```

It should be relatively easy to add this, just a careful change in the GDScript parser to accept `PROPERTY_HINT_FLAGS` near the [place where it parses the `PROPERTY_HINT_ALL_FLAGS`](https://github.com/godotengine/godot/blob/064fd762fae75371658e773a3acf39616e813b08/modules/gdscript/gd_parser.cpp#L2380-L2389).

data.body:
You can quickly check this by enabling "Visible Collision Shapes" in the isometric 2d demo:

![example](https://camo.githubusercontent.com/90a29b8d9f4e0403280307871f69a6bfd56cabd4/687474703a2f2f692e696d6775722e636f6d2f393659487a30542e706e67)

Collision shapes should be visible over the tiles.

data.title: Set the window title as UTF-8 on X11
data.body:
Fixes #2952.
This might not be the best implementation, so feel free to propose something better.
It was also only tested on a system with UTF-8 locale.

data.title: Vector<>::_ptr is now typed and points to the beginning of the array rather than refcounting block
data.body:
Godot-s codebase is a breeze to work with. There is one thing, however that drives me crazy: every time I debug something and want to check content of a String I need to do a pointer arithmetic and a cast in watch window.

Therefore I propose to change _ptr to point to the actual array and be typed, and assume that reference count and size is stored before it. I hope that makes sense.

data.title: [TRACKER] Script editor enhancements
data.body: I love writing code so here are some script editor enhancements I would like to see in Godot. It's not a top priority but it might be a good material for 2.1. What do you think? Add your own ideas. - [ ] optional code minimap #4881 - [ ] optional pigments (display colors in editor) #4882 - [ ] multi-line editing #4884 - [ ] highlight unused variables #4885 - [x] the word (variable, method, etc) highlighting (2.0.2) - [ ] support for foreign characters (new editor font (Inconsolata is neat) + support through the whole engine) - [x] possibility to hide the script list and use tabs to switch between them (maybe even hide inspector ? - small screen mode) (kubecz3k) - [x] full screen mode, ability to switch between scripts that would appear as a list only when needed (similar as the idea above) (purpleorangegames) - [ ] improve autocomplete - extending script, Globals.get(""), paths to resources (jeremi360) - [ ] ability to move scripts up/down in the script list (kubecz3k) - [ ] ability to move between opened scripts on the script list from the keyboard (kubecz3k) - [ ] automatic scrolling when I hit the first line in text selection mode (pressed left mouse button + drag) - [x] numpad arrow/home/end/pgup/pgdn should work as usual when numlock is off (grigi) (Already added by #3269) - [ ] copy-on-select, and paste with middle-click (maybe optional?) (grigi) - [x] tab should enter spaces instead of a tab character (optional mode?) (grigi) - [ ] ability to collapse bundled lines of code (ifs, functions, etc.) (Todor Imreorov via FB) #2732 - [x] go to implementation (jump to the implementation of highlighted function - Shift+F1 works only for built-in functions) (puppetmaster) #3238 #4886 - [ ] split editor horizontally/vertically **(vnen)** #5315 - [ ] Less aggressive error highlighting **(DriNeo)** #7502 - [x] smooth scrolling (not line by line) **(toger5)** #8953 ![scripteditor](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/3484686/11576580/f1a824e4-9a17-11e5-9756-e28cc256d9a5.jpg)

data.title: Fix editor crash after closing scene with certain types of nodes
data.body: Closes #2977, i reproduce the same behavior using a GridMap node, and this patch fixed both.

data.title: [SOLVED] Left Hand Coord System
data.body:
Question 1: will godot ever change to LeftHand?
**Question 2: will the below codechanges create problems** (more important question) :)

i wondered why u dont expose the Left Hand coord system to the user,
knowing openGl is using right hand, but this only because the proj matrix does so.

i hope i dont stamp me to a noob, non geek, tipex user, ...
but isnt LH not much more intuitive? (to normal humans, not 3d geeks) ;)

since i actually porting/rewriting code from my old directX and unity projects, i dont want to convert,
so i tried abit with godot, and changed
camera_matrix.cpp

``` c
void CameraMatrix::set_perspective(float p_fovy_degrees, float p_aspect, float p_z_near, float p_z_far,bool p_flip_fov) {
...
    //matrix[2][2] = -(p_z_far + p_z_near) / deltaZ;
    //matrix[2][3] = -1;
    matrix[2][2] = (p_z_far + p_z_near) / deltaZ;
    matrix[2][3] = 1;
...
```

to make all LH. ( i know this hack only working for perspective )
but this need some thinking about it, do i run into future problems?
i know TriangleCulling changes ( to the one i actually use in dx and unity)
mesh culling and lightning still seem to work (as expected)
is there anything else ive to think about, when doing this?
for example math (LookAt, vector.cross, rotations, quaternion, ....) 
or the physics server (not worked with it yet) or anything else?

greets & thanks in advance 
and remember going forward with RH is going back! :)  or left instead of right... :P
what if i need my mousehand and have to imagine some 3d sh...err things :)

data.title: [SOLVED] partial mesh update?
data.body:
ahoi,

ive a question about meshmanipulation:

if u edit a mesh, for example a changeable terrain,
where u can change the height for the building site,
only 1 -4 vertices change, afaik at the moment uve to remove and reAdd the whole surface to achieve this.

will it ever be possible to "change" partial surface data?
i know unity doesnt support it, so i think there may be a reason, on the other hand there are things like:
glBufferSubData and glMapBufferRange (seems to be slower)

or should a "changeable mesh" be composed of multiple smaller meshChunks (surfaces) to achieve
less vertex data streaming, if so, whats the performance hit, doing so?

greets cw

data.title: Normals not scaled when instance has non uniform scale
data.body:
hello,

ive a problem when creating a meshInstance from a mesh (using visual server directly)
if i provide a transform that has a scale not (x/x/x) then it seems the normals arent updated/scaled.
is this on purpose? or just not supported yet? or do i make a missasumption?

maybe its because of my splatmapshader, im using a shader only with fragment code,
and there i only set DIFFUSE, and uniform in some textures and params.

i dont have a project i could add here (yet), because im developing a module in c++

as an example:
when i have a terrain in size 500/20/500, and a heightmap 100/100
then i create a terrain mesh 0..100/0..1/0..100 (where 0..1 is the height from heightmap)
when creating the the meshinstance for it, ive to scale it from 100/1/100 to 500/20/500

but when doin this, the light is the same all over the terrain, 
because the normals are all very steep 
thats because of height is only 0..1, 
so deltaheights (y) for a triangle are very small, compared to tris x/z => steep normal)
when i fake the normals to reflect the scale all is ok... 
but what if the user changes the scale or size of the terrain...then i have to update the mesh...i dont think it should work this way...
i also could generate the mesh in the "correct" size or "aspect ratio" i may need to do it as a workaround, but still not very cool...

greets and tnx in advance

data.title: Saving scene with tilemap crashes the editor after closing that scene
data.body:
Reproduced with 68d3438a9351498909ffa0bfe79f51b74004e906
1. Add tilemap to the scene
2. Save the scene (format doesn't matter, tested on scn, tscn, xscn)
3. Close it
4. Crash might occour now.. if not click 'scene' it will crash for sure.

Video for quick judge: https://youtu.be/DdZnA33m_SY
